article_title: Trump health plan seeks national wellness
article_text:
Trump health plan seeks national wellness

Photo: Getty Images Waikiki sunset

Keeping abreast of current political developments, travel agent Daphne Bransten forwarded word of sales at Trump hotels around the world. Perhaps in conjunction with the candidate’s seeking favor among the little people, the Trump International Hotel in Waikiki, for example, is offering a 25 percent discount.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: By Leah Garchik
article_metadata.description: Keeping abreast of current political developments, travel agent Daphne Bransten forwarded word of sales at Trump hotels around the world.  Perhaps in conjunction with the candidate’s seeking favor among the little people, the Trump International Hotel in Waikiki, for example, is offering a 25 percent discount.  Pressed for more details — what kind of health care would he propose to replace it? — puzzled voters may refer to the hotel’s descriptive materials.  Trump Hotel Waikiki places your wellbeing at the center of the guest experience — including the ability to maintain, and even elevate, your own healthy lifestyle preferences. ...  At 75, after he retired from the newspaper, he and his wife, Mary Stevens Commanday (mother of slain U.S. Ambassador Christopher Stevens), co-founded San Francisco Classical Voice, an online cultural periodical that was 17 years old when he died.  Sometimes,” wrote Commanday in his last column as a Chronicle critic, “reading an old review, the music, the dance, the performance comes back a bit, and then I know it worked.  During a recent “high heels and bonnets” day in the Castro, revelers hit the streets in heels and huge hats, but no other drag elements.  Mark Abramson spotted two bare-chested gentlemen in heels and hats jumping into the backseat of a car on 18th Street ... and jumping right out again, apologizing.  Dada says he “remembers teenagers driving their parents nuts with pig Latin, so I guess this is the same principle.”  In tribute to Merle Haggard, Ben Fong-Torres of Los Train Wreck suggested a few new verses for “Okie From Muskogee” for last Wednesday’s jam band night at the El Rio:  Related materials at the OMCA store are Stoner Mints and Stone Bars, which are chocolate and may in certain circumstances be craved.
